events.name: Our first coding night ever!
events.description: Hi, for once we're proposing an event in which you'll be coding yourself. Please bring your laptop and you'll be able to choose between the following tracks: - Agile workshop: Technical debt management (Tung Lam Vu) - Spring Data JPA (Cedric Arnoult) - JHipster (Michael Isvy) - Deploying an application on Cloud Foundry (Carlos Queiroz) For all the developer tracks, You'll need to bring a laptop with: - Java installed (7 or 8) - an IDE installed - Maven installed (version 3.3 or later for JHipster) If you don't have a laptop, we'll arrange for you to pair-program with someone else. See you on Monday!
events.location: PayPal office in Millenia Tower, 1 Temasek Avenue Millenia Tower #14-01, Singapore

events.name: AngularJS w/ASP.NET and Practical world implementation on Azure @ 4-May 7:00pm
events.description: AngularJS in an hour by Shawn Wildermuth (United States) Are you still writing your web applications using jQuery and direct DOM manipulation? Itâ€™s time to come in the light and embrace Single Page Applications. In this hour-long talk Shawn Wildermuth will walk you through creating a web app using AngularJS from scratch using ASP.NET. About Shawn: Shawn Wildermuth is an thirteen-time Microsoft MVP (ASP.NET/IIS), the author of eight books and dozens of articles on software development, and a Pluralsight author with fifteen courses to his name. He is one of the Wilder Minds ( http://wilderminds.com ) and can be reached at his blog at http://wildermuth.com Azure Session Entertainment, Trading, Private Equity domains on Azure Cloud (Lessons Learnt from a Real World Project) By Sakthis Kumar About Sakthis Kumar: - Globally spanned 15+ yrs of career in Systems Solutions, Infra Architecture, Information Security and Networks - ISPs, Financial Services, ITES, Logistics Business Domains - Certified Novell Administrator / Engineer since 1997 - Microsoft Certified Professional / Systems Engineer since 1999 - Cisco Certified Network Engineer since 2001 - Qualified Information Security Professional since 2011
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: Papers We Love SG #009
events.description: Paper #1 - Predicting the NFL Using Twitter (http://arxiv.org/pdf/1310.6998v1.pdf) - Abel Molina Paper #2 - QuickCheck: A Lightweight Tool for Random Testing of Haskell Programs (http://www.eecs.northwestern.edu/~robby/courses/395-495-2009-fall/quick.pdf) - Lucas Bradstreet ------------------- What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved? What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss. ----------------- Original Meetup : http://www.meetup.com/papers-we-love Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
